item.description:
Cardano‘s decentralized finances were not the most robust component of the ecosystem, since it only started supplying convenient decentralized solutions in the second half of last year. This tendency was linked to the network‘s core technology of transaction bookkeeping. However, things could change dramatically in 2023. The network’s current TVL is $50 million, a substantial […]

The post Cardano’s DeFi Industry Might Expand Rapidly in 2023 appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Cardano’s DeFi Industry Might Expand Rapidly in 2023 was first posted on January 2, 2023 at 9:40 am.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
Cardano‘s decentralized finances were not the most robust component of the ecosystem, since it only started supplying convenient decentralized solutions in the second half of last year. This tendency was linked to the network‘s core technology of transaction bookkeeping. However, things could change dramatically in 2023.

The network’s current TVL is $50 million, a substantial decrease from the ATH reached in 2022 when the overall value of assets on the network remained at $350 million. Given the scarcity of decentralized solutions in the Cardano ecosystem, such a large number is remarkable.

The Cardano network will issue a slew of algorithmic stablecoins in the new year, which should provide considerably more value to the network than decentralized exchanges or yield farming platforms, given the convenience, they bring to networks and DeFi.

If the market recovers in 2023, Cardano’s TVL might hit new highs, significantly surpassing the relatively modest $350 million seen in 2022.

In comparison, Solana’s TVL crossed the $1 billion barrier in July 2021 and reached the network’s greatest value of locked funds in November, surpassing the $10 billion mark.

The present quantity of locked funds is not going to propel Cardano as an ecosystem to new heights, which is why developers are betting big on the DeFi sector as one of the most important and easiest ways to bring new cash to the network.

At the time of writing, ADA is battling on the market, with a continuous slump despite the favorable end of 2022 and beginning of 2023. The lack of inflows into the cryptocurrency market, as well as the impasse in the DeFi and NFT industries, contributed to the decline of ADA in 2022 and will continue to be the coin’s main source of pressure in 2023.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post Cardano’s DeFi Industry Might Expand Rapidly in 2023 appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Cardano’s DeFi Industry Might Expand Rapidly in 2023 was first posted on January 2, 2023 at 9:40 am.

item.title: Dogecoin Foundation Reveals Launch of New Fund for Core Developers
item.dc:creator: Tinuola Wealth
item.description:
The Dogecoin Foundation has announced a new fund for Dogecoin Core developers to better promote the Dogecoin ecosystem in the coming year. The foundation announced on December 31 that it is contributing 5 million Dogecoin, which is approximately $360,000 at the time of writing, to the new fund to assist in the development of the […]

The post Dogecoin Foundation Reveals Launch of New Fund for Core Developers appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Dogecoin Foundation Reveals Launch of New Fund for Core Developers was first posted on January 2, 2023 at 8:25 am.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
The Dogecoin Foundation has announced a new fund for Dogecoin Core developers to better promote the Dogecoin ecosystem in the coming year. The foundation announced on December 31 that it is contributing 5 million Dogecoin, which is approximately $360,000 at the time of writing, to the new fund to assist in the development of the Dogecoin platform.

The money, according to the Dogecoin foundation, will be housed in a new multi-signature wallet administered by its members and will require three of five signatures from Dogecoin Core developers chromatic, Marshall Hayner, Michi Lumin, Patrick Lodder, and Ross Nicoll. Apart from supervising the release, these custodians will have no rights to the funds. The team wrote:

“The DOGE held in this wallet will disburse rewards to developers of Dogecoin Core for work on all contributions, no matter how big or small.”

For each Dogecoin Core release, 500,000 DOGE will be distributed to developers that contributed to the release. To ensure openness, the team disclosed the wallet address where the funds are stored. The Dogecoin core team will also create blog posts for all expenditures, which will be publicized by the custodians via social media networks.

Similarly, Dogecoin developers recently dismissed speculations that the network might switch to a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism right away. The developers stressed that they simply want to issue a proposal on the subject. One of the developers, Lumin, chastised influencers who spread the notion and stated that they do not have the “inside scoop” on Dogecoin.

On September 16, Dogecoin overtook Bitcoin as the second-largest proof-of-work (PoW) cryptocurrency. After the Ethereum network moved to PoS consensus, the update was released. Some feel that Bitcoin’s proof-of-work consensus should be justified in light of the current development.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post Dogecoin Foundation Reveals Launch of New Fund for Core Developers appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Dogecoin Foundation Reveals Launch of New Fund for Core Developers was first posted on January 2, 2023 at 8:25 am.

[…]

The post ETH Price Analysis: How Will Planned Implementations of Sharding and Withdrawals in 2023 Impact ETH Price appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

ETH Price Analysis: How Will Planned Implementations of Sharding and Withdrawals in 2023 Impact ETH Price was first posted on December 31, 2022 at 5:29 pm.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
• Ethereum (ETH) is marginally up in the last 24 hours at $1200
  • The Ethereum team notes there is a lot around the corner for 2023
  • It says it is actively working on an implementation of sharding which is EIP-4844

Ethereum (ETH) is marginally up in the last 24 hours at $1200, according to CoinMarketCap data. In a blog post, the Ethereum team says there is a lot around the corner for 2023. It says it is actively working on an implementation of sharding, which is EIP-4844, or “Shard Blob Transactions,” to be more precise. It highlights a merge of the EIP-4895 “Beacon Chain Withdrawals” code, with plans to complete the five Ethereum Object Format (EOF) EIPs that are being considered for mainnet by building on top of the initial EIP-3540 implementation. This would enable the joining of an early EOF-focused testnet, which is likely in January 2023. The team also says it will continue working on in 2023, but not limited to, first, the Scheduled and tentative protocol upgrades. Second, withdrawals functionality as this feature will enable stakers to withdraw their balances from the beacon chain to their execution layer accounts. The consensus-layer core specs are nearing completion, and client teams are actively implementing and testing the functionality. Then comes EIP-4844, also known as proto-danksharding. The much anticipated Shanghai hard fork is already semi-scheduled, although the exact contents are still a bit debated.

Key Levels
Resistance Levels: $1,700, $1,500, $1,300
Support Levels: $1,200, $1,000, $800

ETH/USD Daily Chart: Ranging

ETH/USD Daily Chart

The ETH/USD pair remains in extended consolidation at the year’s close and in red as it continues to face headwinds around the $1,200 barrier. The pair’s action has failed to break higher in three consecutive attempts. While the price remains above $1,100, the expected rebound stance may be maintained.

Technical studies on the daily chart show rising positive momentum on the relative strength index (RSI) while the moving average (MA 50 and 200) struggles to exit its bearish setup, underpinning the action. The pair’s ranging conditions may reduce the pace and keep the pair in extended consolidation.

ETH/USD 4-Hour Chart: Ranging

ETH/USD 4-Hour Chart

Ethereum continues to trade within a narrow range for the umpteenth time, with the psychological $1,200 level offering solid support and keeping the downside protected for now, while the upside attempts have repeatedly struggled to register a daily close above the 4-hour moving average (MA 50).

The end-of-year-thinned markets and lack of news keep the pair in a quiet mode, as mixed daily analysis adds to a directionless near-term mode. Following strong rejection at the MA 50, the pair is on track for a monthly close in a bearish candle, generating an initial signal that its consolidation and recovery rally may be stalling.

Note: Kryptomoney.com is not a financial advisor. Do research before investing your funds in any financial asset, presented product, or event. We are not responsible for your investing results

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post ETH Price Analysis: How Will Planned Implementations of Sharding and Withdrawals in 2023 Impact ETH Price appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

The leading crypto asset […]

The post BTC Price Analysis: Bitcoin Finishes 2022 Down 64% as Whale Addresses Dump $10.75 Billion Worth in 13 Months appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
• Bitcoin is trading marginally up in the last 24 hours at $16,555
  • Shark and whale addresses holding 10 to 10,000 BTC have dumped a collective $10.75 billion worth
  • MicroStrategy stated it bought nearly 2,395 Bitcoin at about $42.8 million

Bitcoin is trading marginally higher in the last 24 hours at $16,555. The leading crypto asset is down 3.6% in the last 30 days and 64.9% year to date. BTC’s decline this year puts it on pace for one of its worst annual stretches on record. According to Santiment, two weeks before Bitcoin’s all-time high of nearly $69,000 in November 2021, shark and whale addresses holding 10 to 10,000 BTC dumped a total of $10.75 billion. Per Santiment, this drop, combined with circulation drying up, has led to a sputtering end to 2022. It observes that such returns are reminiscent of the 2018 bear market, which followed a late-2017 Bitcoin rally to an all-time high of $19,800 and saw dip buyers pay dearly as prices fell the following year. The 3.6% decline recorded in December reflected the continued collapse seen throughout the year. In a recent filing, MicroStrategy stated it bought nearly 2,395 bitcoins for about $42.8 million between the start of November and Dec. 21 through its MacroStrategy subsidiary. It then sold 704 of the tokens on Dec. 22 for nearly $11.8 million, citing tax purposes, before buying 810 BTC two days later.

Key Levels
Resistance Levels: $20,000, $18,500, $17,500
Support Levels: $15,500, $13,000, $11,000

BTC/USD Daily Chart: Bearish

BTC/USD Daily Chart

A U-turn from the sell-off point around $25,214 in mid-August was unsettling to see on the daily chart. The decline brought the pair to $15,460 in November. From this point, another rally took place where BTC/USD struggled to reach another high point of $18,385 in December, which means the pair may be open to fresh selling.

A persistent bear market would start if $15,500 was broken, which would confirm a dead cat bounce. Therefore, buyers could turn the situation around at $11,000, but the first barrier remains at $18,500 and $20,000, a crucial level to raise and overcome in the journey higher. This means that Bitcoin is at a critical level as a deeper fall might occur.

BTC/USD 4-Hour Chart: Ranging

BTC/USD 4-Hour Chart

Bitcoin attempted a recovery wave above the $17,500 resistance against the US dollar. BTC/USD even climbed above the $18,000 resistance zone. Looking at the 4-hour chart, the pair struggled to clear a major resistance zone near the $18,300 level. The pair formed a high near $18,385 and started a decline in mid-December.

Earlier, there was a move below the $15,500 support zone. The pair even spiked below the level before starting an upward move from the $15,460 swing low to the $18,385 high. It is now trading well below the $17,000 level, the moving average (MA 50), and the moving average (MA 200). Any more losses might open the doors for a move toward the $13,000 support zone.

Note: Kryptomoney.com is not a financial advisor. Do research before investing your funds in any financial asset, presented product, or event. We are not responsible for your investing results

item.title: What’s in Store for Cryptocurrencies in 2023? Here Are Five Market Predictions
item.dc:creator: Tomiwabold Olajide
item.description:
The crypto market has had a particularly turbulent year, with several decentralized and centralized firms failing or trying to stay afloat. It appears that we are nearing the end of the bear market, with bad individuals and practices being cleansed in a dramatic and necessary process for the overall system’s maturation. Regardless, the Web3 innovations […]

The post What’s in Store for Cryptocurrencies in 2023? Here Are Five Market Predictions appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

What’s in Store for Cryptocurrencies in 2023? Here Are Five Market Predictions was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 4:34 pm.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
The crypto market has had a particularly turbulent year, with several decentralized and centralized firms failing or trying to stay afloat.

It appears that we are nearing the end of the bear market, with bad individuals and practices being cleansed in a dramatic and necessary process for the overall system’s maturation.

Regardless, the Web3 innovations that emerge from this crypto winter will revolutionize the world. Following the events of 2022, the year 2023 is offered with a mixed perspective. Rather, the forecasts are mixed.

Here Are Five Predictions

1. Mark Connors, head of research for Canadian crypto asset manager, said he expects a price rebound in 2023 and TradFi businesses, among others, to take a more active role not just in finding applications for blockchain technology, but also in regulatory development.”Leadership will come from the corporate side, not the regulatory side,” Alex Connors predicts.

2. Second, 2023 will be a watershed moment for digital assets. It will be the fundamental Layer 1s, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and TradFi firms using NFTs. In 2022, the ecosystem consisted of alt-level coins such as Solana, Algorand, and others supplying the majority of the non-Bitcoin, Ethereum, and stablecoin market cap.

3. According to Connors, the Fed might stop quantitative tightening before the third quarter. They will halt because the Treasury market might fail as it did in September 2019. Money markets will crash, the Fed will print, and cryptocurrency will fall as precipitously as it did in March 2020. As a market, we’re still in our infancy. We do not control our own fate based on pricing and adoption.

4. Fourth, stablecoins will find additional uses outside of crypto capital markets, resulting in greater mainstream adoption — particularly among enterprises — and innovation inside Web3. Governments and private blockchain developers will continue to do research and development, with some announcing centralized public infrastructure such as central bank digital currencies or marketplace infrastructure.

5. While cryptocurrency venture capital funding will continue to fall through the first half of 2023, this is not necessarily a bad thing; rather, it is normalizing to a rational level. Investors don’t want to catch a falling knife, so they’re waiting for a bottom while also considering broader macroeconomic issues and the potential of a worldwide recession.

At the same time, new settlements (layer 1s/2s), interoperability (layer 0/bridge), lending, and trading protocols will be funded to fill the void left by previous hacks, treasury shortfalls, regulatory changes, and exchange collapses.

Overall, Web 3 will continue to grow
“Larger macroeconomic downturn market conditions should hopefully drive crypto initiatives away from speculation and more towards utility – one big utility category just being meaningful, entertaining, social interactions,” Alex Zhang, the de facto leader of Friends with Benefits DAO, predicts.

He anticipates growth in “interoperable identity, on-chain social graphs, and crypto-abstracted social experiences,” as well as “more meaningful Web3 social platforms and protocols.”

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post What’s in Store for Cryptocurrencies in 2023? Here Are Five Market Predictions appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

What’s in Store for Cryptocurrencies in 2023? Here Are Five Market Predictions was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 4:34 pm.

item.title: What Happened in Crypto Market in 2022? 83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges
item.dc:creator: Tomiwabold Olajide
item.description:
In 2022, cryptocurrencies experienced a tough year defined by industry failures and plummeting prices. The price decline began in late 2021. That’s when inflation rates began to rise, raising fears that the Federal Reserve might raise borrowing costs when the calendar flipped. Bitcoin fell 19% in December as investors shifted into assets deemed safer in […]

The post What Happened in Crypto Market in 2022? 83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

What Happened in Crypto Market in 2022? 83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 4:01 pm.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
In 2022, cryptocurrencies experienced a tough year defined by industry failures and plummeting prices. The price decline began in late 2021.

That’s when inflation rates began to rise, raising fears that the Federal Reserve might raise borrowing costs when the calendar flipped. Bitcoin fell 19% in December as investors shifted into assets deemed safer in an uncertain economy.

The sell-off continued in January, with Bitcoin down 17% and Ethereum down 26%. The crypto winter did not arrive for several months. Markets even temporarily stabilized. Then, in May, stablecoins were formally declared unstable. A stablecoin is a sort of digital currency that is pegged to the US dollar one-to-one.

When TerraUSD or UST fell below $1 and its sister token, LUNA tumbled, a different kind of fear ensued. The peg had gone. Confidence vanished. The fall of LUNA took the loss of more than $40 billion in wealth. Suddenly, it appeared that nothing in crypto was safe.

The major cryptocurrencies plummeted, with bitcoin falling 16% in a single week, down by more than half from its peak six months earlier. On the macroeconomic front, inflation showed no signs of abating, and the central bank remained committed to raising rates to the extent necessary to halt the rise in consumer prices. The bottom fell out in June.

Because of “extreme market conditions,” lending platform Celsius halted withdrawals. BlockFi, a crypto lender, also cut 20% of its personnel after more than quintupling since the end of 2020.

Three Arrows Capital, or 3AC, a prominent crypto hedge fund, defaulted on a debt worth more than $670 million, and FTX negotiated an agreement allowing it to buy BlockFi at a fraction of the company’s latest private valuation.

In June, Bitcoin experienced its worst month on record, shedding about 38% of its value. Ethereum fell by more than 40%. Then there were the bankruptcies.

3AC, based in Singapore, declared bankruptcy in July, just months after revealing that the company had $10 billion in assets.

The firm’s risky strategy entailed borrowing money from throughout the industry and then investing it in other, typically fledgling, crypto businesses.

Following the demise of 3AC, crypto brokerage Voyager Digital was not far behind. This is due to 3AC’s significant default on a Voyager loan.

Celsius was the next to seek Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in mid-July. Customers were being paid up to 17% interest to hold their cryptocurrency on the platform. It would lend those assets to counterparties prepared to pay exorbitant interest rates.

As liquidity ran out, the framework crumbled. Meanwhile, Bankman-Fried was portraying himself as an industry savior. Then came the most calamitous tumble: FTX’s precipitous fall in November, following Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao’s statement that his company was selling its FTT tokens, the native currency of FTX.

83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges

83 billion Shiba Inu tokens were burned in 2022, according to SHIB Burn Tracker. This amount is comparable to $1.74 million at an annual arithmetic average SHIB price of $0.000021. Furthermore, at the start of the year, 83 billion SHIB represented 0.014% of the total token supply.

According to a crypto analyst, Lark Davis, 572,000 bitcoin left exchanges in 2022. Only 11% of the total supply is left on exchanges, about 2.1 million coins.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post What Happened in Crypto Market in 2022? 83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

What Happened in Crypto Market in 2022? 83 Billion SHIB Burned While 572,000 BTC Left Exchanges was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 4:01 pm.

item.title: Here Is What Crypto Traders Are Monitoring As Year Ends; 2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur
item.dc:creator: Tomiwabold Olajide
item.description:
According to blockchain analytics firm Santiment, 2022 was arguably the most visible year in terms of crypto markets being influenced by news events. Santiment observes that as the year ends, traders are monitoring four major news events: the pandemic, second is the FTX collapse, and the arraignment of its cofounder, Sam Bankman-Fried. The third issue […]

The post Here Is What Crypto Traders Are Monitoring As Year Ends; 2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Here Is What Crypto Traders Are Monitoring As Year Ends; 2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 3:34 pm.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
According to blockchain analytics firm Santiment, 2022 was arguably the most visible year in terms of crypto markets being influenced by news events.

Santiment observes that as the year ends, traders are monitoring four major news events: the pandemic, second is the FTX collapse, and the arraignment of its cofounder, Sam Bankman-Fried. The third issue at hand has to do with getting clues on the Fed’s interest rate hikes to come in 2023. Then last is the Russia-Ukraine War news.

Santiment predicts that as FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, and doubt) eases on these four issues, prices might likely rise.

2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur

Alex Gladstein, chief strategy officer of the Human Rights Foundation, comments on a Bitcoin conference held in Ghana. “I was blown away,” says Gladstein. “They’re all just building on bitcoin.

It’s legitimately amazing,” he says, which is why he believes that “global adoption might probably be the number one story for 2023.”

Analyst Michael van de Poppe predicts a target of $38,500 for Bitcoin. Coin bureau analyst ‘’Guy’’ rather doesn’t make a price prediction for Ethereum and believes that a flippening could happen and ETH might reach five digits. On the other hand, He believes that the cryptocurrency might trade sideways next year.

According to Santiment, Quant, Decentraland, and Enjin are among the largest market cap assets that saw significant amounts of coins leaving exchanges in 2022. Though their respective prices are down big, as is the rest of crypto, it highlights that these are good signs for a better 2023.

There is also a stable growth of daily active addresses for Augur (REP). Santiment analysts predict that a downward trend in the value of the token might be reversed and the reversal to growth will begin.

Is the contagion over?
“The contagion is far from done,” says Cas Piancey, co-host of the “Crypto Critics’ Corner” podcast. Piancey believes that “businesses, banks, and funds are urgently hoping the market gets past the FTX and Alameda collapse or simply concentrates on their misconduct,” but whether individuals like it or not, “you can’t wish away a credit crunch and exposure to problematic counterparties.

We will see the closure of funds and the failure of companies that we did not predict, largely because the contagion is too vast and too difficult for us all to estimate.”

“Harsh crypto regulation will be presented, and the community will wage an epic battle to combat the aspects of it that endanger decentralization,” says Laura Shin, host of the “Unchained” podcast.

On the other hand, Santiment believes Bitcoin’s ranging prices have a lot to do with declining whale interest. If prices continue sliding and a spike in Whale interest occurs, this might be a historically bullish signal.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post Here Is What Crypto Traders Are Monitoring As Year Ends; 2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Here Is What Crypto Traders Are Monitoring As Year Ends; 2023 Predictions for Bitcoin, Ethereum, MANA, Enjin Coin, Augur was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 3:34 pm.

item.title: Binance Enables Apple Pay, Google Pay Payment Services
item.dc:creator: Tinuola Wealth
item.description:
The crypto exchange revealed in its latest Binance Build update that the platform had integrated the two payment systems. The Binance team confirmed on Twitter, “Apple Pay and Google Pay payment options are now available on Binance! Purchase crypto, with ease.” Customers can now purchase Bitcoins using either Apple Pay or Google Pay. The upgrade […]

The post Binance Enables Apple Pay, Google Pay Payment Services appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

Binance Enables Apple Pay, Google Pay Payment Services was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 11:37 am.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
The crypto exchange revealed in its latest Binance Build update that the platform had integrated the two payment systems.

The Binance team confirmed on Twitter,

“Apple Pay and Google Pay payment options are now available on Binance! Purchase crypto, with ease.”

Customers can now purchase Bitcoins using either Apple Pay or Google Pay. The upgrade has already been implemented, and preliminary feedback indicates that the new capability is functional.

This strategy would be beneficial in attracting more clients to Binance, especially given Apple Pay’s 44 million and Google Pay’s 25 million user bases. Both of these payment platforms are the most popular in the world, with the first and second-most users, respectively.

The move to embrace these two payment systems will make Binance and cryptocurrencies in general more accessible to a large number of potential customers. This update has the potential to bring in the newest crypto customers for Binance and the rest of the crypto sector. However, the truth remains that these two payment options are not available in every country. It remains to be seen how Binance will do.

Binance is hardly the first cryptocurrency company to accept more mainstream payment methods. Apple Pay has been embraced by various cryptocurrency platforms, such as MetaMask. In March 2022, this crypto wallet, which is the main method of interacting with the Ethereum blockchain (DeFi, Web3 dApps, NFTs), integrated Apple Pay into its platform. Klever, another cryptocurrency wallet, implemented Apple Pay support in April 2021 to provide consumers with a more convenient payment alternative.

The cryptocurrency exchange has recently made headlines after it was revealed that Binance.US intended to acquire Voyager Digital assets. The cryptocurrency exchange made a $1 billion bid and was successful in acquiring the Voyager assets just a few weeks ago.

Binance had also temporarily halted USDC stablecoin withdrawals, causing some market-wide concern in mid-December. The stated reason for the pause was a lack of USDC reserves, which required a BUSD to USDC swap before the service could restart as usual.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post Binance Enables Apple Pay, Google Pay Payment Services appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

item.title: FTX Users Fund in Crypto Worth $3.5B Withheld by Bahamian Regulator
item.dc:creator: Tinuola Wealth
item.description:
Users of FTX who were caught up in the shocking collapse of the cryptocurrency exchange might finally hear some good news from the Bahamas. The Bahamas’ Securities Commission (SCB) announced on Thursday that it has successfully preserved $3.5 billion in cryptocurrency linked to its local affiliate, FTX Digital Markets (FTXDM), the organization behind Sam Bankman-Fried’s […]

The post FTX Users Fund in Crypto Worth $3.5B Withheld by Bahamian Regulator appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

FTX Users Fund in Crypto Worth $3.5B Withheld by Bahamian Regulator was first posted on December 30, 2022 at 10:43 am.
©2021 "Latest Crypto News". Use of this feed is for personal non-commercial use only. If you are not reading this article in your feed reader, then the site is guilty of copyright infringement. Please contact me at info@kryptomoney.com
item.content:encoded:
Users of FTX who were caught up in the shocking collapse of the cryptocurrency exchange might finally hear some good news from the Bahamas.

The Bahamas’ Securities Commission (SCB) announced on Thursday that it has successfully preserved $3.5 billion in cryptocurrency linked to its local affiliate, FTX Digital Markets (FTXDM), the organization behind Sam Bankman-Fried’s international platform.

The Commission stated that it perceived dangers to the platform’s surviving digital assets after FTX was subject to cyberattacks before declaring bankruptcy in November. With the aid of infrastructure start-up Fireblocks, it was able to get a court order to protect the cryptocurrency.

At the time of the transfer on November 12, market prices were used to determine the worth of the remaining assets. Since then, the cryptocurrency markets have remained largely stable.

The assets will be kept by the Commission until the Supreme Court instructs it to distribute them to creditors. Although its legal authority to do so is still in question, it has now asked for permission to disclose information about the assets in FTX’s US-based bankruptcy proceedings.

The Bahamas’ Securities Commission (SCB) said it will:

“continue to conduct a comprehensive and diligent investigation into the causes of FTX’s failure, act in accordance with directions issued by the Supreme Court of The Bahamas, collaborate with other supervisory authorities, and take such further actions as needed to preserve the assets of FTXDM and to safeguard the interests of customers and creditors of FTXDM.”

Per reports, the Department of Justice is investigating the hacking event that resulted in the unauthorized withdrawal of approximately $500 million in cryptocurrency from FTX’s functioning hot wallets.

According to lawyers, the top 50 FTX companies owe between 100,000 and one million debtors’ money, totaling $3.1 billion. FTX claims that Bankman-Fried stole billions of dollars worth of cryptocurrency and transferred it to the trading unit Alameda Research, which ultimately lost the money by employing dangerous market tactics.

Last week, Bankman-Fried was extradited from The Bahamas to the US, where he will now be prosecuted on an enormous eight-count indictment that includes fraud and conspiracy allegations. Gary Wang, the chief technical officer of Alameda Research, and Caroline Ellison, the company’s CEO, have already entered guilty pleas to related crimes.

While he waits for his trial, Bankman-Fried is currently under house arrest at his parent’s house in California. A $250 million bond backed by the mansion was signed, and a US Magistrate Court granted him bail.

Image Credit: Shutterstock

 

The post FTX Users Fund in Crypto Worth $3.5B Withheld by Bahamian Regulator appeared first on Latest Crypto News.

item.content:encoded:
• The price of Shiba Inu (SHIB) slightly rose over the past 24 hours
  • At the time of writing, SHIB was up 1.83% at $0.0000081
  • Shytoshi Kusama, lead Shiba Inu developer, is preparing for a huge Shibarium launch

The price of Shiba Inu (SHIB) slightly rose over the past 24 hours, outperforming several cryptocurrencies. At the time of writing, SHIB was up 1.83% at $0.0000081 as the general crypto market posted losses. Shytoshi Kusama, the lead Shiba Inu developer, is preparing for a huge Shibarium launch. Kusama recently tweeted that he was meeting with Unification Foundation developers to complete and launch Shibarium, a layer-2 solution, “very soon.” The announcement has already sparked interest in the Shiba Inu community. For the time being, investors are waiting for additional information on Shibarium’s development progress, and Kusama’s team is now “aligning, onboarding, and finalizing” the much-anticipated layer-2 solution before its release. Shibarium is one of the most ambitious projects in the Shiba Inu ecosystem, and Kusama’s team is hard at work on it. The layer-2 solution will allow users to benefit from faster transactions at lower costs. The layer-2 solution will provide users with faster transactions cheaply, allowing them to benefit from an improved user experience.

Key Levels
Resistance Levels: $0.00001518, $0.00001300, $0.00001000
Support Levels: $0.00000800, $0.00000700, $0.00000600

SHIB/USD Daily Chart: Ranging

SHIB/USD Daily Chart

SHIB/USD initially traded higher the prior day but retreated around $0.00000828. While pulling down, bears emerged as traders focused on levels around $0.00000800. To begin investigating the bearish scenario, a substantial decline below $0.00000790 is required. The pair may continue to fall, with pessimistic traders looking for a goal around $0.00000700.

Subsequent growth from $0.00000800 might be viewed as the next phase of growth inside a long-term consolidation trend. Further increases are expected as long as the $0.00000800 support is maintained. Meanwhile, a strong breakout of $0.00000885 would demonstrate that the bounce from $0.00000712 is still on, bringing the bounce back into focus.

SHIB/USD 4-Hour Chart: Ranging

SHIB/USD 4-Hour Chart

The SHIB/USD intraday bias is turning positive as consolidation from $0.00000779 continues. Continuous progress is expected until a minor support level of $0.00000800 is sustained. However, only a rise over the relative strength index (RSI) midline of 50 would reverse the neutral to bearish picture.

A break of the minor resistance zone at the 4-hour moving average (MA 50) at $0.00000820 should result in a retest of the upper level of $0.00000950. A sustained breach of the minor support level at $0.00000800, on the other hand, would extend the correction with another drop to $0.00000700.

Note: Kryptomoney.com is not a financial advisor. Do research before investing your funds in any financial asset, presented product, or event. We are not responsible for your investing results
